body: I just ran into problems with number three, trying to fix the merge hub cancellation ticket (#23205), I think that it must be very clearly documented that the future is always failed at some future point.
I think it's a bug. How would you distinguish if a callback was processed or not if it is always failed in the end?
Yes, you are right, they must be completed successfully when the invoke did succeed.

issue.body:
Here are two experiments: first commit just uses synchronized to access the shared state, second one just uses a simple list which is much faster to update than a map and a set and which is only cleaned up every 1000 callbacks.

/cc @johanandren, @patriknw
